trans-unit.source: This guide will show you how to use [ClearDB] to create a MySQL database from the [Azure Store] and how to create a MySQL database as a linked resource when you create a [Azure Web Site][waws] .
trans-unit.target: This guide will show you how to use [ClearDB] to create a MySQL database from the [Azure Store] and how to create a MySQL database as a linked resource when you create a [Azure Web Site][waws] .

trans-unit.source: [ClearDB] is a fault-tolerant database-as-a-service provider that allows you to run and manage MySQL databases in Azure datacenters and connect to them from any application.
trans-unit.target: [ClearDB] is a fault-tolerant database-as-a-service provider that allows you to run and manage MySQL databases in Azure datacenters and connect to them from any application.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] When you create a MySQL database as part of the Website creation process, you can only create a free database.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] When you create a MySQL database as part of the Website creation process, you can only create a free database.

trans-unit.source: Creating a MySQL database from the Azure Store allows you to create a free database or choose from paid options.
trans-unit.target: Creating a MySQL database from the Azure Store allows you to create a free database or choose from paid options.

trans-unit.source: How to: Create a MySQL database from the Azure Store
trans-unit.target: How to: Create a MySQL database from the Azure Store

trans-unit.source: To create a MySQL database from the [Azure Store], do the following:
trans-unit.target: To create a MySQL database from the [Azure Store], do the following:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the [Azure Management Portal][portal].
trans-unit.target: Log in to the [Azure Management Portal][portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **+NEW** at the bottom of the page, then select **MARKETPLACE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **+NEW** at the bottom of the page, then select **MARKETPLACE**.

trans-unit.source: Select add-on from store
trans-unit.target: Select add-on from store

trans-unit.source: Select **ClearDB MySQL Database**, then click the arrow at the bottom of the frame.
trans-unit.target: Select **ClearDB MySQL Database**, then click the arrow at the bottom of the frame.

trans-unit.source: Select ClearDB MySQL Database
trans-unit.target: Select ClearDB MySQL Database

trans-unit.source: Select a plan, enter a database name, and select a region, then click the arrow at the bottom of the frame.
trans-unit.target: Select a plan, enter a database name, and select a region, then click the arrow at the bottom of the frame.

trans-unit.source: Purchase MySQL database from store
trans-unit.target: Purchase MySQL database from store

trans-unit.source: Click the checkmark to complete your purchase.
trans-unit.target: Click the checkmark to complete your purchase.

trans-unit.source: Review and complete your purchase
trans-unit.target: Review and complete your purchase

trans-unit.source: After your database has been created, you can manage it from the **ADD-ONS** tab in the management portal.
trans-unit.target: After your database has been created, you can manage it from the **ADD-ONS** tab in the management portal.

trans-unit.source: Manage MySQL database in Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Manage MySQL database in Azure portal

trans-unit.source: You can get the database connection information by clicking on **CONNECTION INFO** at the bottom of the page (shown above).
trans-unit.target: You can get the database connection information by clicking on **CONNECTION INFO** at the bottom of the page (shown above).

trans-unit.source: MySql connection information
trans-unit.target: MySql connection information

trans-unit.source: How to: Create a MySQL database as a linked resource for Azure Website
trans-unit.target: How to: Create a MySQL database as a linked resource for Azure Website

trans-unit.source: To create a MySQL database as a linked resource when you create a [Azure Web Site][waws], do the following:
trans-unit.target: To create a MySQL database as a linked resource when you create a [Azure Web Site][waws], do the following:

trans-unit.source: Log in to the [Azure Management Portal][portal].
trans-unit.target: Log in to the [Azure Management Portal][portal].

trans-unit.source: Click **+NEW** at the bottom of the page, then select **COMPUTE**, **WEBSITE**, and **CREATE WITH DATABASE**.
trans-unit.target: Click **+NEW** at the bottom of the page, then select **COMPUTE**, **WEBSITE**, and **CREATE WITH DATABASE**.

trans-unit.source: Create website with database
trans-unit.target: Create website with database

trans-unit.source: Provide a **URL** for your website, select the **REGION** for your site, and choose **Create a new MySQL database** from the **DATABASE** dropdown.
trans-unit.target: Provide a **URL** for your website, select the **REGION** for your site, and choose **Create a new MySQL database** from the **DATABASE** dropdown.

trans-unit.source: Optionally, you can replace the default name for the connection string.
trans-unit.target: Optionally, you can replace the default name for the connection string.

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Provide website details
trans-unit.target: Provide website details

trans-unit.source: Provide a database **NAME**, select the **REGION** for your database (this should be same as the region for your website), agree to ClearDB's legal terms, and click the checkmark at the bottom of the frame.
trans-unit.target: Provide a database **NAME**, select the **REGION** for your database (this should be same as the region for your website), agree to ClearDB's legal terms, and click the checkmark at the bottom of the frame.

trans-unit.source: Provide MySQL details
trans-unit.target: Provide MySQL details

trans-unit.source: After your website has been created, click on the name of your site to go to your site's dashboard.
trans-unit.target: After your website has been created, click on the name of your site to go to your site's dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Go to web site dashboard
trans-unit.target: Go to web site dashboard

trans-unit.source: Click on **CONFIGURE**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **CONFIGURE**.

trans-unit.source: Go to configure tab
trans-unit.target: Go to configure tab

trans-unit.source: Scroll down to the **connection strings** section and click **Show Connection Strings**.
trans-unit.target: Scroll down to the **connection strings** section and click **Show Connection Strings**.

trans-unit.source: Show connection string
trans-unit.target: Show connection string

trans-unit.source: Copy the connection string for use in your application.
trans-unit.target: Copy the connection string for use in your application.

trans-unit.source: Shown connection string
trans-unit.target: Shown connection string

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Connection strings are accessible to your website application by connection string name.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Connection strings are accessible to your website application by connection string name.

trans-unit.source: In .NET applications, connection strings are availble in the **connectionStrings** object.
trans-unit.target: In .NET applications, connection strings are availble in the **connectionStrings** object.

trans-unit.source: In other programming languages, connection strings are accessible as environment variables.
trans-unit.target: In other programming languages, connection strings are accessible as environment variables.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to Configure Web Sites][configure].
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to Configure Web Sites][configure].
